author: Rachel Frazin
description: {beacon} Energy & Environment   The Big Story  Defense bill allows for longer use of PFAS-based foam The latest version of the National Defense Authorization Act (NDAA) gives the Pentagon more time to use firefighting foam that contains “forever chemicals.” © Photo Credit Lawmakers on Sunday released a negotiated version of the annual defense authorization bill that...
title: Defense bill allows for longer use of PFAS-based foam

author: Lee Ann Anderson
description: Young voters are more likely to identify as liberal and are increasingly critical of President Trump's job performance, new polling conducted by the Yale Youth Poll found. Forty-six percent of voters under age 30 self-identified as liberal, the Monday poll shows. his marks an increase from spring polling, which found that 39.3 percent of voters...
title: Young voters more likely to self-identify as liberal: Survey

author: Tara Suter
description: Rep. Nancy Mace (R-S.C.) took a swing at House Republican leadership in a new opinion piece for The New York Times. “I came to Congress five years ago believing I could make a difference for my constituents, for South Carolina and for a country I love deeply. I was the first woman to graduate from...
title: Mace rails against House GOP leadership in NY Times op-ed: 'Why am I even here?'

author: Filip Timotija
description: European powers rallied behind Ukraine on Monday after President Trump lashed out at Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky a day prior, accusing him of not reading the U.S.-proposed peace plan to end the Russia-Ukraine war.  "We stand with Ukraine," British Prime Minister Keir Starmer said on Monday as the leader was hosting German Chancellor Friedrich Merz,...
title: European powers rally behind Ukraine after Trump lashes out at Zelensky

author: Josh DuBose
description: A 31-year-old social worker was stabbed to death inside Zuckerberg San Francisco General Hospital late last week, a tragic incident that some officials have criticized as “predictable and preventable.”
title: California patient accused of stabbing social worker to death inside hospital

author: Max Rego
description: The Department of Transportation (DOT) on Friday rescinded an $11 million penalty on Southwest Airlines imposed during the Biden administration. The order from the DOT amends its 2023 directive, which fined Southwest $140 million, $35 million of which was due to the U.S. Treasury in three installments. Southwest made the first two payments, $12 million...
title: Trump administration drops Biden-era $11M fine on Southwest Airlines

author: Meaghan Mobbs, opinion contributor
description: This week, the 32nd Ministerial Council of the Organization for Security and Co-operation in Europe (OSCE) met in Vienna, but the U.S. ambassador’s seat sat empty.
title: Absence is acquiescence: US can’t afford to step back from the global stage

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: CNN anchor Jake Tapper defended his colleague, Kaitlan Collins, after President Trump called her “stupid and nasty” for purportedly asking about his plans for the White House ballroom. In a post on the social platform X, Tapper corrected the spelling of Collins’s name and pushed back on his characterization of his fellow anchor and CNN’s...
title: Tapper comes to Kaitlan Collins's defense after Trump attack

author: Max Rego
description: Utah Gov. Spencer Cox (R) poked fun at Notre Dame for opting out of a bowl game Sunday. The Pop-Tarts Bowl, set for Dec. 27, reportedly invited the 10-2 Fighting Irish and 11-2 BYU to compete. Notre Dame, though, passed on the opportunity after it was not selected to compete in the College Football Playoff...
title: Utah governor taunts Notre Dame after bowl game refusal: 'Absolutely the right move'

author: Juan Williams, opinion contributor
description: Democrats are closing out 2025 with momentum, having won double-digit victories in Virginia and New Jersey, and are now looking ahead to 2027 with the need for a plan to address key issues such as Trump's impeachment, inflation, healthcare, and Supreme Court expansion.
title: Democrats, create Project 2027 and hope your wave comes

author: Julia Shapero
description: President Trump on Monday hinted at an executive order taking aim at state AI laws after a preemption effort fell short in Congress.  “There must be only One Rulebook if we are going to continue to lead in AI,” Trump wrote on Truth Social. “We are beating ALL COUNTRIES at this point in the race, but that won’t last long if we...
title: Trump hints at AI executive order, knocks states' efforts

author: Douglas E. Schoen and Carly Cooperman, opinion contributors
description: Even Trump’s voters are voicing their disapproval, underscoring how widespread voters’ disapproval is.
title: Republicans’ bad win in Tennessee bodes ill for the midterms

author: Caroline Vakil
description: Former Rep. Colin Allred (D-Texas) announced on Monday that he would be dropping his bid for Texas Senate and instead running for Texas's new 33th Congressional District as Rep. Jasmine Crockett (D-Texas) is widely anticipated to launch a bid for Sen. John Cornyn’s (R-Texas) seat. “In the past few days, I’ve come to believe that...
title: Allred drops Texas Senate bid, makes run for House seat

author: Harrison Kass, opinion contributor
description: As much respect as everyone has for the Marines, their service branch became redundant and dependent on other branches long ago.
title: The Marine Corps just had its 250th birthday — now let's abolish it

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene (R-Ga.) said President Trump’s own words “directly fueled” death threats against her family. In an interview that aired Sunday on CBS’s “60 Minutes,” the Georgia Republican said she "got a pipe bomb threat on my house" immediately after Trump called her a "traitor." "And then I got several direct death threats...
title: Greene: Trump labeling her 'traitor' 'directly fueled' death threats against family

author: Jared Gans
description: Plus: Supreme Court hears case on presidential power, Trump hosts Kennedy Center Honors, Tim Walz faces scrutiny
title: Health care fight heads to fever pitch
